item.title: Dune Awakening Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
Dune: Awakening is an MMO survival game that takes place in an alternate timeline in which Paul Atreides was never born. The game allows players to explore Arrakis, with combat, crafting, and lore-friendly survival elements playing a vital role in proceedings.

Like a lot of other modern video games, Dune: Awakening also features redeemable codes, which players can use to get unique cosmetic items. Some Dune Awakening codes are single use and thus can only be redeemed by one player, but others can be used by anybody.

All Dune Awakening Codes

Working Dune Awakening Codes

  • WAKE-THE-SLEEPER - Redeem code for the Frameblade Kindjal skin (NEW)

Dune Awakening codes are case sensitive, so players should copy and paste them into the code redemption box.

Expired Dune Awakening Codes

  • There are currently no expired codes for Dune Awakening .

How to Redeem Codes for Dune Awakening

Rather than redeeming their Dune Awakening codes in-game, players will need to navigate to a special code redemption webpage. Once there, they should link their Steam account, after which, they may need to verify their email address. It's then just a simple case of navigating to the REDEEM KEY tab, typing or pasting a code into the box, and then clicking the CONTINUE button. After players confirm the redemption, their rewards will be available in-game.

  1. Navigate to the Dune Awakening Account page.
  2. Link your Steam account and verify your email address if needed.
  3. Click on REDEEM KEY.
  4. Type or paste one of the working Dune Awakening codes from the list above into the product key box and then press the CONTINUE button.
  5. Press the CONFIRM button.

How to Get More Dune Awakening Codes

The best place to find new Dune Awakening codes is right here, as we'll be keeping an eye across all of the game's socials for more codes and will update the list above whenever we find one. For those who'd like to search for themselves, the Dune: Awakening Discord server is a good place to start, as too is the game's official Twitter account. There's really no telling if and when new codes will be released, though, so it's a good idea to check regularly to avoid missing out.

item.title: I Like the Switch 2, But the Wii U Launch Was Way More Exciting
item.description:
Summary

  • The NIntendo Switch 2 launch doesn't feel quite as exciting as previous Nintendo systems.
  • Even though things didn't work out with the Wii U, it tried something new and featured a greater variety of big-budget launch exclusives.
  • Nintendo played it safe with the Switch 2, which will likely be better for the console in the long run.

The Nintendo Switch 2 is finally out, and while it's always exciting whenever a new console drops, I feel somewhat underwhelmed compared to previous Nintendo launches - even the Wii U. The Nintendo Switch 2 has become an immediate commercial success, with a great deal of praise for its advances over the previous Switch. But while the Switch 2 is an impressive machine, its launch lineup exclusives leave a lot to be desired.

The Nintendo Switch 2 has launched with five exclusives, one of which is a remaster of a 3DS game. Mario Kart World is the console's standout launch exclusive, joined by fellow racing game Fast Fusion , glorified instruction manual Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour , Bravely Default: Flying Fairy HD Remaster , and Konami's Survival Kids co-op game. Otherwise, the Switch 2 launch lineup is largely made up of games that have been out for years and so-called physical releases tied to Game-Key Cards.

Mario Kart World is great, but Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour is one of the worst games I've played this year, and the other launch exclusives are not exactly lighting the world on fire. The Wii U launch had a similar problem of recycled multiplatform releases, but it had a greater variety of big-budget launch exclusives. New Super Mario Bros. U was derivative of past entries, but it still gave Nintendo fans a brand-new Super Mario game to play through with 4-player co-op support. Nintendo Land made brilliant use of the Wii U GamePad and remains one of the most-unique local multiplayer experiences out there. And ZombiU was, in my opinion, the hidden gem of the Wii U launch exclusives, offering a challenging twist on the zombie game genre that also did a great job utilizing the Wii U's unique features to their full potential. It's one of my favorite Wii U games and a title that I think is highly underrated. The Switch 2 has one big budget launch exclusive in Mario Kart World , with its other launch exclusives being lower-profile games compared to what the Wii U delivered in 2013.

Wii U's Launch Exclusives Were More Interesting than the Switch 2's

The lead-up to the Wii U was more exciting than the Switch 2, primarily because of the differences in the launch lineup, but also because the Wii U did something new. The console's name, Nintendo's marketing, and significant content droughts obliterated the Wii U's chances of coming anywhere close to the success of its predecessor, but it was doing something new . The Switch 1 was also doing something bold and different, combining the handheld and home console experience to deliver a radically innovative device that has had a profound impact on the industry. The Switch 2 is a souped-up, more powerful version of the Switch 1 concept, lacking the imagination that has gone in to Nintendo consoles since the Wii revolution.

Now, that's not necessarily a bad thing. By playing it safe this generation, Nintendo virtually guarantees success for the Switch 2. The Switch 1 is on track to become the best-selling video game console of all time, and so it wouldn't make sense for Nintendo to do something radically different right now. A more powerful take on the Switch 1 is exactly what the Switch 2 needed to be, but it has made for a launch that feels relatively safe and not as exciting as previous Nintendo console generations.

item.title: Mouse: P.I. for Hire, Into the Unwell Are Following the Trail Blazed by Cuphead
item.description:
Summary

  • Mouse for Hire: P.I. and Into The Unwell emulate Cuphead's retro art style and intense gameplay.
  • Both games promise unique experiences, blending charming animation with the FPS and third-person roguelite genres.
  • With Mouse: P.I. releasing sometime in 2025 and Into The Unwell coming to Early Access, fans can expect two distinctly entertaining adventures.

2025's Summer Game Fest main event just wrapped up. Once again, the annual showcase featured a bevy of exciting new game announcements and world reveals from indie to AAA titles, including the long-awaited next Resident Evil entry to cap it all off. Among the numerous games seen, though, two titles in particular— Mouse for Hire: P.I. developed by Fumi Games, and Into The Unwell from She Was Such A Good Horse—stood out for their striking resemblance to one of 2017's most recognized and well-received games: Cuphead . Both Mouse for Hire: P.I. and Into The Unwell 's artistic designs call to mind Cuphead 's trademark Steamboat Willy -style animation direction.

Cuphead 's signature art style along with its nail-biting and demanding gameplay made it a big hit for many players. Now, it looks like Into The Unwell and Mouse for Hire: P.I. are taking heavy inspiration from Cuphead by following in its footsteps and utilizing a similar juxtaposition of charmingly retro art with intense gameplay action across two different genres.

Mouse for Hire: P.I. has a 2025 release window, although it does not have a firm date as yet. Into The Unwell will be entering Early Access later in the year, with closed beta sign-ups now open for its forthcoming playtest.

Into The Unwell and Mouse: P.I. for Hire Look to Capture the Retro Cartoon Style and Chaotic Action Popularized by Cuphead

Mouse for Hire: P.I. and Into The Unwell Are Clearly Channeling Cuphead's Aesthetics

While many games have sought to deliver increasingly realistic and lifelike graphics as the generations have advanced, Cuphead cleverly bucked this trend and captivated audiences with its bold take on the "rubber hose" animation that hearkens back to the 1930’s American period of cartoons. The same is immediately apparent upon viewing the latest trailers for Mouse for Hire: P.I. and Into The Unwell , as both titles highlight their use of this amusingly exaggerated style. It seems as if perhaps " Cuphead -likes" may soon be a thing, with these two games incorporating similar artistic visions along with their own unique spins and mechanics.

Into The Unwell and Mouse for Hire: P.I. Promise Intense and Zany Experiences Like Cuphead's

As described on its official Steam page, Mouse for Hire: P.I. is "a noir-fueled, action-packed first-person shooter. Private Eye Jack Pepper will discover that the city of Mouseburg has become corrupt, teeming with heavily armed gangs of crooks, mobs, and other shady characters. The monochromatic hand-drawn visual style and retro jazz soundtrack were also created with the same techniques of the era." One other notable aspect announced at SGF was that Mouse for Hire will feature Troy Baker as the voice behind its hard-boiled detective protagonist. The prolific voice actor lending his talent to Mouse gives it another enticing layer on top of entertainingly bombastic shooting within its wacky world.

Into The Unwell 's satirical premise and framework likely bring to mind developer Double Fine's beloved classic series, Psychonauts . Into The Unwell will see fans play as an assortment of "heavily medicated misfits in a delightfully despondent fever dream of a third-person action roguelite." Featuring single-player as well as up to three-person co-op, gamers will "embark on a spirit quest to seek self-control and find victory through their vices. They'll encounter bizarre bosses and quirky characters as they fight their way through the surreal surroundings of The Unwell." Into The Unwell will also give players an array of strange and hilarious weapons, including a giant ice cream cone and a lobotomized lollipop, as well as a progressive system to unlock upgrades and other powers.

With a mix of stylized violence and comedic presentation centered around unique art direction and respective takes on their genres, fans of Cuphead and this style in general should be sure to keep their eyes on Mouse for Hire: P.I. and Into The Unwell, as they promise to deliver great new adjacent experiences.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Fans Are Losing It Over the Description of Jeff's New Skin
item.description:
Summary

  • Jeff's ability rework in Marvel Rivals allows Joyful Splash to damage enemies and heal allies simultaneously.
  • Marvel Rivals fans are entertained by the unique description of Jeff's Sunshine Land Shark skin.
  • Some players have taken issue with the current design of Wolverine's new Weapon X skin.

Marvel Rivals players have taken to social media to discuss the description associated with Jeff's new Sunshine Land Shark skin, which seems to feature a hidden message. NetEase Games recently revealed its major Season 2.5 update for Marvel Rivals , which brought the villain Ultron to the popular hero shooter as a flying Strategist.

The recent patch that introduced Season 2.5 contained some major changes for Jeff the Land Shark in Marvel Rivals , which caused a bit of controversy within the community. The biggest change involved Jeff's Joyful Splash ability, which has the Strategist shoot a stream of water to heal nearby allies. The rework now allows Joyful Splash to pierce through allies and enemies while dishing out both healing and damage simultaneously. As a byproduct of this change, Jeff can also charge his ultimate ability faster than before.

In a recent post on Reddit, DapperMudkip shared an image of the description for Jeff's Sunshine Land Shark skin in Marvel Rivals , which seemed to amuse many fans. The description appears to feature Mister Fantastic chastising The Thing for sending "random messages" in the emergency chat of The Fantastic Four. He then quoted the message and asked if The Thing was using some kind of cipher to communicate.

Jeff’s New Skin Features a Hidden Message in Marvel Rivals

At first glance, it would seem that Marvel Rivals ' Jeff the Land Shark may have simply taken The Thing's phone and sent nonsense messages to The Fantastic Four's emergency group channel. However, a couple of gamers mentioned that the message could be shifted by 22 letters to spell out "jeffthelandsharkisthebest" and "ilovekrakoa." Many fans reacted with surprise and delight, with some stating that they could hardly believe NetEase Games would include something so random in the description for a skin. Jeff's Sunshine Land Shark costume was released on June 5 and is available as part of a cosmetic bundle for 2,200 Units.

Jeff the Land Shark wasn't the only hero to receive a new skin, as NetEase Games also released a Weapon X costume for Wolverine in Marvel Rivals . The skin draws inspiration from the comics, showing an even more feral version of the popular Duelist after he escaped the Weapon X program. Unfortunately, not everyone is happy with NetEase Games' version of the costume. It would seem that some players have taken issue with the pants Wolverine is wearing, as they're a big departure from the original design that shows the mutant wearing almost no clothing. While some may be split on the cosmetic's design, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: How To Use The Joy-Con As A Mouse On The Switch 2
item.description:
Aside from the power, console gamers have often heard about the benefits of using mouse controls in games versus a standard controller. In shooters, the accuracy and speed of a mouse are hard to dispute when compared to a controller, even when they're as good as the Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller.

Moreover, mouse controls are perfect for strategy games like Sid Meier's: Civilization 7 - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition and Nobunaga's Ambition: Awakening - Complete Edition. It's also a great match for classic point-and-click adventure games like Blade Runner. This guide shows players how to use their Joy-Cons as a mouse controller in their games.

How To Use A Joy-Con Like A Mouse

The Switch 2 has new features that allow the Joy-Con 2 controllers to be used as a mouse with compatible games. Nintendo recommends attaching the Joy-Con 2 strap to allow for a smoother function across clean surfaces . Align the "+" or "-" symbols on the straps with the controller and push them together. You can then put the strap over your wrist and face the sensors down with your index finger on the R or L button to click the button and use the control stick to scroll up and down pages and menus with your thumbs.

How To Connect A USB Mouse & Keyboard To The Switch 2

The Nintendo Switch 2 can connect a proper mouse and keyboard, in addition to allowing the Joy-Con 2s to function like a mouse. This setup works perfectly with shooters like Cyberpunk 2077 on the Switch 2, and you can utilize a keyboard to navigate your character around the game world. To connect a keyboard and mouse, first, place the Switch 2 in docked mode to play on a TV or monitor. Then, connect your keyboard and mouse to the two available USB ports on the side of the Switch 2's dock. Once they are plugged in, you will be able to use these controls with compatible games.

Mouse-Compatible Nintendo Switch 2 Games

Here is a list of confirmed games (released and upcoming) that feature mouse compatibility on the Nintendo Switch 2:

  • Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour
  • Bravely Default: Flying Fairy HD Remaster
  • Cyberpunk 2077: Ultimate Edition
  • Deltarune
  • Hogwarts Legacy
  • Kunitsu-Gami: Path of Goddess
  • Nobunaga's Ambition: Awakening - Complete Edition
  • Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S
  • Sid Meier’s Civilization 7
  • Drag x Drive
  • Game Builder Garage
  • Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road
  • Metroid Prime 4: Beyond
  • Mouse Work
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree
